alert.note: Alert for Caroline (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 1:18PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Caroline and north central Hanover Counties through 145 PM EDT... At 117 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Kings Dominion, or 8 miles north of Randolph Macon College, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Kings Dominion around 145 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Oliver, Burruss Corner, Gum Tree, Coatesville, Doswell, Noel and Penola. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
